title: 820 3536 - stuck on SPDIF
message:
is there a quick fix for this board? i know that can you remove a resistor on some boards to skip the SPDIF detection sense.


thanks

title: 820 3536 - stuck on SPDIF
message:
Dirty headphones connector.
Check YouTube, you will found some videos about how to deeply clean it.

title: 820 3536 - stuck on SPDIF
message: I've already cleaned before I made this thread. cant disable SPDIF on this one?

title: 820 3536 - stuck on SPDIF
message:
didn't work. I can still see the red light in the port and digital out is still showing in the setting.

i forgot to mention, I can hear chime on the internal speaker and headphone is also working. it changes from digital to headphone when i insert a headphone jack,


edit. not L6607 neither.

how come chime is working?

i'll try R6330

title: 820 3536 - stuck on SPDIF
message: removing R6330 hasn't worked. it just turns off the optical red light. so the only way is to replace the headphone port?

title: 820 3536 - stuck on SPDIF
message:
R6330 is SPDIF output; it does not help to switch from SPDIF to speakers.
Check L6606 is OK; try removing it.
Check how L6606 voltage change when insert headphones.

Also check SPKRCONN_L/R_ID.

title: 820 3536 - stuck on SPDIF
message:
after try cleaning it more. now its stuck on headphone mode only. say goodbye to this port.

what is the best way to remove a headphone port from a donor board without melting the grey plastic?

title: 820 3536 - stuck on SPDIF
message: Use low melt on the through hole joints and blast full heat and air (450 at 120 on the Quick) at the joints on top of the board NOT the plastic. It should come off fairly quickly and the port should not get burned

title: 820 3536 - stuck on SPDIF
message:
i tried low melt..there is solder on the other side a swell.


[img]https://i.imgur.com/Jtc562S.jpg[/img]

lol..brute force didn't work on a donor board, i guess its time to order some from aliexpress.
